---
title: "jwt_invalid_jwks_url.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file defines authentication settings for a system, specifically focusing on JWT (JSON Web Token) authentication. It sets up the basic authentication requirements, session parameters, and JWT configuration with an invalid JWKS (JSON Web Key Set) URL.

## Symbols

### `authentication`
#### Description
The root configuration object for authentication settings.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets the overall authentication requirement
- Defines session parameters
- Specifies authentication methods, particularly JWT

### `authentication.required`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether authentication is mandatory for the system.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| required | boolean | Determines if authentication is required |

### `authentication.session`
#### Description
Configures session-related parameters for authentication.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets the domain for the session
- Configures the secure flag for session cookies

### `authentication.session.domain`
#### Description
Specifies the domain for which the session is valid.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| domain | string | The domain URL for the session |

### `authentication.session.secure`
#### Description
Determines whether the session should use secure cookies.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| secure | boolean | Flag to enable or disable secure cookies |

### `authentication.methods`
#### Description
Defines the authentication methods available in the system.

### `authentication.methods.jwt`
#### Description
Configures the JWT authentication method.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables or disables JWT authentication
- Specifies the JWKS URL for token verification

### `authentication.methods.jwt.enabled`
#### Description
A boolean flag to enable or disable JWT authentication.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | Determines if JWT authentication is enabled |

### `authentication.methods.jwt.jwks_url`
#### Description
Specifies the URL for the JWKS (JSON Web Key Set) used to verify JWT signatures.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| jwks_url | string | The URL of the JWKS endpoint |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| authentication.required | boolean | true | Determines if authentication is required |
| authentication.session.domain | string | "http://localhost:8080" | The domain URL for the session |
| authentication.session.secure | boolean | false | Flag to enable or disable secure cookies |
| authentication.methods.jwt.enabled | boolean | true | Determines if JWT authentication is enabled |
| authentication.methods.jwt.jwks_url | string | " http://localhost:8080/.well-known/jwks.json" | The URL of the JWKS endpoint |

## Error Handling
This configuration file contains an intentional error in the `jwks_url` value. The URL has a leading space, which is invalid and may cause issues when the system tries to fetch the JWKS. This appears to be a test case for handling invalid JWKS URLs in the authentication configuration.
